intro: Myosotis capitata, commonly known as the clustered forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, sky-blue to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins and wetlands. Myosotis capitata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also an important species for ecological research due to its unique adaptations to its native environment.
